Looks like your broker isn't up or configured properly

For now the solution to this is to create a calculated column as a case when statement or handling it upstream in a pipeline or a view.

If Superset was to allow for a mapping construct in the UI, it should probably be reusable across Slices and Datasources. Assuming mapping often means grouping as in mapping goes many-to-one, it would have to be translated to a case-when expression so that the db itself performs the proper grouping. 

There would also be a need to add some UI component that applies mappings to columns on top of that.

Another approach would be in the direction of a comprehensive sql expression editor, perhaps more integrated as a popover in the explore view. My vote goes in that direction.

  CELERY_IMPORTS = ('superset.sql_lab', )
  CELERY_RESULT_BACKEND = 'redis://localhost:6379/'

CELERY_CONFIG = CeleryConfig

After this if u ll try do CSV export we will not get latest groupby column result, we will get same saved slice details.

@ujhujuh thanks for this PR. These a great additions, however we are about to launch V2 of the explore/slice page and will be deprecating V1. You will need to make these changes to the V2 code in a new PR. You can find the front end code for V2 here: https://github.com/ascott/superset/tree/master/superset/assets/javascripts/explorev2

and you can see the V2 code path in views.py here: https://github.com/airbnb/superset/blob/master/superset/views.py#L1497

thx @darabos!

> It displays an error until you set a range.
> The measure line's color does not get set for some reason.
> Would be nice to provide a way to set the ranges/markers from metrics as well.
> The bullet chart is stretched to fill the height of the panel. It looks pretty bad until you resize the panel.

^^^ we should fix these things before we ship
also, V1 will be deprecated soon, so this only needs to work in V2. we are doing some beta testing now and will be fully moving over to V2 in the next couple weeks.

Trying to answer your questions:
* v1 will be deprecated as soon as v2 is 100% working, should be a few weeks
* v2 will allow for arbitrarily complex controls 
* `is_timeseries=false` still allows for time filtering, but should hide `Granularity`
* you can add a `height` parameter if you don't want height to fill the box, consider adding an option to fill the container, perhaps when height=0

I don't understand "Would be nice to provide a way to set the ranges/markers from metrics as well."

Solution:

@ceilingcat - 
```
pip uninstall caravel
pip install superset
superset init
superset db upgrade
superset runserver ...
```
should do it.

import export functionality was implemented to transfer metadata across
service instances.
Superset will work fine with caravel database and there will be no loss of
data.
